entry.title: Princess of a Broken City
entry.summary:
Author: DoraZeExplora00

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,438Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Riri didn’t plan to need anyone. Jason Todd didn’t plan to stay. What begins as fleeting encounters and sharp-edged flirtation turns into something heavier—trust, dependence, and feelings neither of them are ready to name. As trauma resurfaces and Gotham tightens its grip, they must decide whether running is safer than staying.

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,601Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 634

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: The Gotham Promethus
entry.summary:
Author: up_tonogood

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,078Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 34

Summary: A reimagining of Mary Shelley’s Frankenstein: The Modern Prometheus, but the creature is Jason Todd. Dick Grayson sails into the Arctic, chasing whispers that his lost brother, Jason, may still walk the world of the living. You are a young artist, hired for an Arctic exhibition, who becomes entangled in a web of grief, rebirth, and a bunch of angsty monologues.

entry.title: The Bloom Knot
entry.summary:
Author: nocteris

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,383Chapters: 6/22Kudos: 57

Summary: “I suggest we ignore that it happened.” Your jaw physically dropped, “what?” “You got any soul marks on you?” You had already checked a million times, but you still removed your gloves to show him. Both ring fingers clean, you flexed them in his direction. “Same here,” he waved his already bare hands, clean as day. “So, we forget it ever happened unless some strange shit happens.” ——— Where you and Jason accidentally trigger the curse of soulmates— a curse that binds you to the first person you touch hands with. The plan was simple, to avoid each other. There was no way you—a STEM major, would cross paths with him anyway. So, what the hell were you doing in his Comparative Literature 121 lecture hall?

entry.title: Apartment 3B
entry.summary:
Author: ElaineInABox

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,044Chapters: 11/15Kudos: 485

Summary: You weren’t looking for love, just somewhere cheap, quiet, and safe enough to get you through the semester. Jason Todd wasn’t looking for company, just a roommate who wouldn’t ask questions about why he came home at two AM bloody and bruised.But in a cramped apartment in Crime Alley, between burnt coffee, leaky ceilings, and the soft hum of the city that never sleeps, the silence between you starts to change. What begins as survival becomes something quieter, steadier—something that almost feels like home.

entry.title: delayed satisfaction is the sweetest
entry.summary:
Author: dreamtiming

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,614Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 34

Summary: “That’s why you keep asking to go on patrol with me, right? My cutting intellect?” He asks, dipping a fry from his takeout box in a pool of ketchup. You wonder if the splotch on his sleeve is from a rather exuberant dip, or if it’s blood from earlier. “Among other things.” You say, feeling like it’s finally your turn to offer someone an ambiguous response. Especially as he returns to this topic of conversation he is so insistent on having out with you. For emphasis, you take a great bite of your food to allot you more time to muster defenses. “What other things?” Jason presses, because it might work with someone else—but not him, who, with no protection of the mask to guide his face, bores his eyes into you. “Like the fact that you paid for the food.” You offer gleefully, both of you knowing this is unsatisfactory. “Can’t be the only thing.” He says, his tone surprisingly level. Why on earth is your heart beating so fast? tl;dr: stuck in the middle with you. Dick Grayson/Reader/Jason Todd
